remarks: Lemma for ~ lclkr .  Use ~ lshpat to show that the intersection of a hyperplane with a noncomparable sum of atoms is an atom.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lclkrlem2a.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lclkrlem2a.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrlem2a.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrlem2a.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2a.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2a.p $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2a.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2a.a $e |- A = ( LSAtoms ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2a.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lclkrlem2a.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lclkrlem2a.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lclkrlem2a.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lclkrlem2a.e $e |- ( ph -> ( ._|_ ` { X } ) =/= ( ._|_ ` { Y } ) ) $.
lclkrlem2a.d $e |- ( ph -> -. X e. ( ._|_ ` { B } ) ) $.
lclkrlem2a $p |- ( ph -> ( ( ( N ` { X } ) .(+) ( N ` { Y } ) ) i^i ( ._|_ ` { B } ) ) e. A ) $.
